subject: Automobile Racing
Fines (Penalties)
lead_paragraph: Renault was not penalized despite being found guilty of having confidential information about its Formula One rival McLaren. In September, McLaren was fined $100 million for using confidential data from Ferrari. In the latest allegations in Formula One’s spy scandal, the World Motor Sport Council summoned Renault officials to face accusations that the team had unauthorized access to details on McLaren’s cars.
